This game is a piece of shit

Overwatch 2 is probably my saddest moment when it comes to video game experiences. I've been playing Overwatch since first anniversary, in 2016. It was something I could clearly call a comfort game. The excitement from every opened FREE lootbox which was an almost perfect way to motivate players to actually play the game. The game wasn't perfect, that's for sure, but now the Overwatch 0.5 (because looking at the current state of the game it could be called more regress than progress) is a very shadow of itself. Strictly limited amount of heroes for new players (which completely ruins the core gameplay of Overwatch) (OFC YOU CAN PAY FOR THEM FOR REAL MONEY), the bane of every multiplayer game's existence, battle pass, in its worst release (you couldn't even earn enough currency on premium BP to buy another one in the future), skins that were formerly FREE are now behind a horrifyngly high paywall. ActiBlizz doesn't even hide the game is just money-making machine, it's no longer an Overwatch that used to be. It's just depressing how Blizzard destroyed that good game. I don't want even start to talk about this new PvE campaign which costs 15 US DOLLARS FOR THREE MISSIONS WHICH COULD BE COMPLETED IN MORE OR LESS ONE HOUR. You know what also costs up to 15 dollars and is definitely more fun? I dunno, bunch of games which developers actually care about players and not just their wallets. Even I don't play Overwatch anymore, seeing more and more news about its downfall is just depressing. I don't really know what ActiBlizz wanted to achieve by releasing their already behated product on a platform which is a motherland for far better Team Fortress 2.

Overwatch 2 is the sequel to the popular team-based shooter game Overwatch. It has a delightful design, a fantastic cast of characters, and some of the best multiplayer maps I've ever played on. It includes new features like as hero skill trees, configurable abilities, hero progression, and PvE objectives. However, I found the game to be unsatisfactory and irritating for a variety of reasons.

To begin with, the matchmaking mechanism is unfair and uneven. It does not consider the participants' rank or level, and frequently pairs inexperienced players with experienced ones. This makes it difficult for beginners to enjoy the game, as they are readily destroyed by the pros.

Second, the game is built around hero selection and team synergy. Every character has their own set of perks and disadvantages, and some work well with others while others do not. To acquire new characters in Overwatch 2, you must either grind or buy, which limits your options and choices. This also has an impact on the competitive mode, as you can fight opponents with more characters than you.

Third, the battlepass system is a sham. The free awards aren't worth the effort, and the premium incentives are excessively expensive. The legendary skins are ridiculously expensive, costing roughly Â£20 each. Worse, unlike in Overwatch, you can no longer obtain skins for free by leveling up or opening lootboxes.

Fourth, the PvE mode is disappointing. I was quite enthusiastic for this mode because it was meant to provide a fresh way to play the game by introducing new tasks and difficulties. However, after more than three years of waiting, the majority of the PvE features that were announced were cancelled. The offered PvE tasks are tedious and monotonous.

In conclusion, Overwatch 2 is a mediocre sequel that falls short of expectations. It contains numerous defects and issues that make it difficult to enjoy. It also attempts to extract money from the gamers by charging them for everything. I would not recommend this game to anyone who enjoys Overwatch or wants to try out a different shooter.

I cannot suggest the game to anyone since it has been soiled by such aggressive greed.
